intro: Randia troposepala, commonly known as the broadleaf randia, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four to five petals. Randia troposepala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
